DOC.brief_title: Improving Chronic Pain Treatment Primary Care
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Chronic pain common , associated substantial impairment increase healthcare utilization . Implementation treatment guideline problematic , chronic pain remain undertreated . Because prevalence chronic pain among veteran , VHA create National Pain Management Strategy adopt pain `` 5th vital sign . '' Objectives : Our primary objective determine extent collaborative intervention improve chronic pain-related outcome ( pain-related function , pain severity depression severity ) VA primary care set six 12 month . We also investigate extent intervention affect 1 ) treatment comorbid depression , 2 ) adherence provider guideline chronic pain , 3 ) patient provider satisfaction attitude related chronic pain treatment , 4 ) incremental benefit ( pain disability-free day ) incremental health service cost . Methods : The study cluster randomize control trial collaborative care intervention `` Assistance Pain Treatment '' ( APT ) versus treatment usual ( TAU ) five primary care clinic one Department Veterans Affairs Medical Center . 401 patient 42 primary care clinician participate . APT include 2-session clinician education program , patient assessment , education activation , symptom monitoring , feedback recommendation clinician facilitation specialty care . We randomize clinician APT TAU , nest patient within clinician intervention status . Patients recruit via mailing advertise flyer ; chart-documented musculoskeletal pain diagnosis report least moderate pain severity pain-related function ( Chronic Pain Grade [ CPG ] ) last least 12 week invite participate . Participants complete questionnaire baseline , 3 , 6 12 month , subset re-assessed 30 month . Primary outcome Roland-Morris Disability score CPG pain intensity scale score 12 month . Depression assess use Patient Health Questionnaire 9 [ PHQ-9 ] score . Intervention effect patient outcome variable test use intention-to-treat analysis multilevel model ; patient-level covariates age , sex , baseline depression severity , baseline opioid status ( yes/no ) , medical morbidity include . To quantify provider adherence pain treatment guideline , create Pain Process Measure ( PPM ) , chart review checklist . Clinicians complete baseline 23-item survey attitude behavior related chronic pain management , job satisfaction , satisfaction local pain resource . Patient satisfaction measure include patient-rated global impression change , global VA health care satisfaction , health-related quality life , receipt rating effectiveness VA chronic pain treatment . Pain disability-free day calculate Roland-Morris Disability Questionnaire score . Data VA treatment cost obtain VA 's Decision Support System utilization except certain intervention activity track separate study database . Status : Complete .
